name: ebFRET
tagline: ebFRET performs combined analysis on multiple single-molecule FRET time series to learn a set of rates and states
body:
### Consensus analysis of many single-molecule FRET time series

![Example Traces](https://raw.github.com/ebfret/paper-icml/master/figures/fig_example_traces_500dpi.png)

ebFRET is a library written in Matlab for the analysis of single-molecule FRET time series with hidden Markov models. 

It is the successor of [vbFRET](http://vbfret.sourceforge.net), which it improves upon by performing combined analysis of multiple time series at once. This approach, known as _empirical Bayes_, is both more accurate and statistically robust. It also enables more advanced analysis use cases such as sub-population detection.

![Inference Accuracy](https://raw.github.com/ebfret/paper-icml/master/figures/fig_accuracy_vs_noise_v2_500dpi.png)

### Example Usage
```
data = load_fret('my_data.dat');
eb = eb_fret(data.fret, [2,3,4], 10);
tracePlotter(data.fret, 'vit', eb(3).vit);
```

### Get the Source

We are currently working on a stand-alone GUI for usage in a lab environment. In the mean time, a command-line version of our code can be found here [[git](https://github.com/jwvdm/ebfret); [zip](https://github.com/jwvdm/ebfret/archive/master.zip)]

### Read the Paper

_``Hierarchically-coupled hidden Markov models for learning kinetic rates from single-molecule data.''_
Jan-Willem van de Meent (@jwvdm), Jonathan Bronson, Frank Wood, Ruben Gonzalez, Chris Wiggins. Accepted at [ICML 2013](http://icml.cc/2013/) [[pdf](https://github.com/ebfret/paper-icml/raw/master/vandemeent_icml_2013.pdf)]
